Other Information.Test Conditions: 298 K, vapor phase; liquid phase equimolar mixture of styrene and ethylbenzene
Other Information.Additional Info: Styrene uptake reaches saturation after 8 hours, with a capacity of 1.05 mol/mol at 6 Torr.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 298 K, vapor phase; liquid phase equimolar mixture of styrene and ethylbenzene
Other Information.Additional Info: Ethylbenzene requires significant deformation of the macrocyclic cavity for accommodation, with a lower uptake capacity of 0.69 mol/mol at 6 Torr.

Sieving Mechanism: Selective encapsulation of planar styrene over nonplanar ethylbenzene due to cavity deformation requirements

Experimental Validation.Method: Single crystal X-ray diffraction (SCXRD), powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD), thermogravimetric analysis (TGA), density functional theory (DFT) calculations
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Styrene selectivity: 99% in liquid phase, 88% in vapor phase

Other Information.Additional Info: The material exhibits structural transformation upon guest adsorption, forming ST@1 and EB@1 phases. The system is recyclable and stable in water for over 7 days.
